projectDesc.p: "To the tune “Immortal by the River”-Beyond The Willows" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the tune “Immortal by the River”-Beyond The Willows
Beyond the willows there is light thunder, over the pond it rains.
The tinkle of the rain shatters the sound of lotus leaves.
At the western corner of the building, a rainbow appears.
I wait for the moonlight to emerge.
Swallows fly by, peeking from the painted rafter.
I let down the curtain from the jade hooks.
The lines on the bamboo mat are flat like still waves,
By the side of which a fallen hairpin lies.
